intro: Canthium leucophloeum, commonly known as the white-veined spurge, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant features palmate leaves with prominent white veins, giving it its common name. Its flowers are small and clustered, typically yellow or greenish in color. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or thickets.
